intro: Verbascum sudanicum, commonly known as the Sudanese mullein, is a flowering plant native to the arid regions of Africa and the Middle East. It is characterized by its tall, hairy stems and large, fuzzy leaves that can reach up to 30 centimeters in length. The plant produces showy yellow flowers in late spring to early summer, which are clustered in dense, candle-like inflorescences. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in dry, open habitats such as grasslands and rocky areas. Verbascum sudanicum is a hardy species that is adapted to withstand drought and high temperatures.
